summary: H.R. 4006, the "Mission UNPLUGGED Act," aims to prohibit the use of cellular phones and other distracting electronic devices by students in schools operated by the Department of Defense Education Activity (DODEA) during regular school hours. The bill mandates the Director of DODEA to establish and maintain this policy, including exceptions for emergencies, extracurricular activities, medical needs, disabilities, English learners, and other circumstances deemed appropriate.  The bill also provides for support for schools to implement this policy, including funding for lockboxes or similar storage solutions and requires annual reports to Congress regarding its implementation and impact.
